senses.de: Something that is done or happens to make people happy or interested.
senses.ex: We enjoyed a weekend of music and entertainment.

Tips.title: Types of Entertainment
Tips.description: Entertainment can be live shows, movies, games, or activities. It's meant to engage and delight.
Tips.example: The festival offered various types of entertainment like puppet shows and magic acts.

Tips.title: Not Always Funny
Tips.description: Not all entertainment is humorous; some can be thrilling, dramatic, or educational.
Tips.example: The documentary provided entertainment by making us think differently about nature.

Tips.title: Cultural Variations
Tips.description: What's considered entertainment can vary greatly across cultures and personal preferences.
Tips.example: For some, a chess tournament is great entertainment; for others, it’s a concert.

senses.de: The action of providing or being provided with amusement or enjoyment.
senses.ex: People who work in the entertainment industry.

Tips.title: Entertainment Industries
Tips.description: The businesses around creating fun, like movies and music, are part of the entertainment industry.
Tips.example: He moved to Hollywood to pursue a career in the entertainment industry as an actor.

Tips.title: Passive or Active
Tips.description: Entertainment can be passive, like watching a movie, or active, like playing a sport.
Tips.example: They wanted active entertainment, so they played a team-building game.

Tips.title: Technology and Entertainment
Tips.description: Advancements in tech have expanded entertainment, like video games and virtual reality.
Tips.example: Virtual reality has added a new dimension to home entertainment options.

Amusement.wordDefinition:
The main difference between amusement and entertainment is that amusement refers to something that makes you feel amused or laugh, while entertainment refers to something that occupies your time and keeps you engaged or interested.

For example, going to an amusement park is meant to be amusing because you ride fun roller coasters and eat cotton candy that makes you laugh and feel happy.

Amusement is more about temporary enjoyment while entertainment is more about occupying your time in a pleasant way.

Distraction.wordDefinition:
Distraction means something that takes away your attention from something important, while entertainment means activities or things that you do for fun, enjoyment or relaxation.

Distractions can be harmful because they can prevent you from doing important things like studying, working, or paying attention to what's happening around you.

So, distractions are mostly unwanted and can have negative consequences, while entertainments are usually chosen and have positive effects.

Diversion.wordDefinition:
Diversion refers to something that is used to distract or redirect attention away from something else.

It can be used to help people take a break, relax or deal with stress. Examples of diversions include hobbies, games, and puzzles.

Overall, diversions are used to help people take a break or cope with stressful situations, while entertainment is all about enjoyment and leisure.

Enjoy.wordDefinition:
Enjoy refers to the feeling of pleasure and happiness that someone experiences from an activity, object, or experience.

For example, a person can enjoy eating their favorite food or spending time with their friends.

These activities are designed to provide enjoyment or entertainment to the participants or spectators.

In essence, enjoy refers to the personal feeling of pleasure, while entertainment refers to external activities or performances that are designed to create that feeling for others.

Fun.wordDefinition:
Fun describes any activity that is enjoyable, pleasurable or amusing, usually performed with friends and family or in groups.

Entertainment can be both fun and pleasing to watch, while fun activities are typically less formal and less polished. People often seek out entertainment when they want to be entertained or stimulated, while fun is something that people do to have a good time, relax and let off some steam.

Leisure.wordDefinition:
Leisure refers to free time that can be spent doing whatever one desires, whether that be playing sports or taking a walk in the park.

Entertainment is something that we seek out to pass our leisure time. We want to be entertained, distracted or amused during our free time.

Whereas leisure is any unoccupied time that one has free to spend in any way that they choose.

Entertainment is a specific activity that is done for fun or enjoyment, while leisure is a broader concept that refers to free time in general.

Merriment.wordDefinition:
Merriment refers to a state of excitement or amusement usually characterized by laughter, happiness and joy; it is the natural response to something funny or enjoyable.

People often experience merriment when they are having fun with friends, family, or in a festive setting.

Entertainment is planned and usually involves a performance, while merriment is a natural and spontaneous reaction to something enjoyable.

Both words can be used in different situations, but entertainment is better suited to describe something that is planned like a movie or concert, while merriment is better suited to describe a happy and festive environment or spontaneous fun with friends.

Pastime.wordDefinition:
Pastime, on the other hand, refers to a hobby or leisure activity that someone enjoys doing in their free time. Examples include reading books, playing sports, drawing, or playing an instrument.

Pastimes are usually a form of active participation, meaning the person is actively engaged in the activity and is not just a spectator.

Entertainment is something we consume for enjoyment, while a pastime is an activity we participate in for recreation or leisure.

Pleasure.wordDefinition:
Pleasure refers to a feeling of satisfaction or enjoyment that is experienced when we engage in something that we enjoy or find pleasurable.

Pleasure can come from a wide range of experiences, including entertainment, but it can also come from other sources like food, nature, or spending time with loved ones.

Entertainment is a form of pleasure, but pleasure can come from many other sources besides entertainment. Entertainment is applicable in situations where we are seeking out a specific form of amusement, while pleasure can be experienced in a wide range of settings and situations.

quotes.Text: This is where you see the truth of entertainment, because it is not edited. You see it on stage as it is happening. Even if we fall down or forget our words, it's a part of live entertainment.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Eartha Kitt

quotes.Text: Don't let anyone turn you into a slave. You're a slave if you let the media tell you that sports and entertainment are more important than developing your brain.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Ben Carson

quotes.Text: Besides entertainment and action, I want to educate. You know, as a producer or director, we do have a responsibility to society.

quotes.Text: I do show violence as entertainment. Clearly, I'd be a liar if I said I didn't.

quotes.Text: I know for a fact entertainment is more important than winning.

quotes.Text: The world is a stage, the stage is a world of entertainment.

quotes.Text: Providing new means of entertainment is the important thing.
